IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: The mission of the Association is to promote the improvement and enhancement of theological schools in the United States and Canada for the benefit of communities of faith and the broader public.
IRS990.MissionDesc: The mission of the Association is to promote the improvement and enhancement of theological schools in the United States and Canada for the benefit of communities of faith and the broader public.
IRS990.Desc: Leadership Education for Theological Educators - The purpose of this program is to improve theological schools by enhancing the skills of their leaders. Through a program of targeted events, the program reaches administrative leaders and faculty in a range of administrative functions and experience levels. The program serves the administrators and faculty of 270+ member schools of the Association. The program is funded by tuition and fees from participants and a foundation grant.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: Organizational & Educational Models and Practices - The project seeks to engage ATS member schools in assessing current and developing educational modals and practices of theological education, identifying the most promising aspects of these models for the education and formation of theological leaders, and establishing the normative acceptance of these models in the work of the Association and its related ATS Commission on Accrediting. The project is funded solely by a foundation grant.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: Pathways for Tomorrow Coordination: This project seeks to coordinate the learning among the more than 100 member schools that received a grant from a national foundation to consider the pathways for the future of their missions and those they serve. This project was fully grant funded.

ProgSrvcAccomActyOtherGrp.Desc: The Association provided other programming for issues and initiatives that impact theological education, research on institutional viability within its schools, and promoting engaging research on relevant topics for the industry. The Association performs data collect and analysis for North American theological education. The Association engages and communicated to the membership and broader public about all that it is learning. The Association provides services to the Commission on Accrediting of the Association of Theological Schools.

Form990PartVIISectionAGrp.TitleTxt: Senior Director of Design & Organizational Learning

SupportedOrganizationName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: Commission on Accrediting of the Association of Theological Schools

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The use of the Association's endowment fund, known as the New Century Fund, is to provide assets from which the Association can draw to provide funding for programs as determined by its board that will support the improvement and enhancement of theological schools for the betterment of communities of faith and the broader public and to provide certain organizational infrastructure costs.

AccountActivitiesOutsideUSGrp.RegionTxt: North America (including Canada and Mexico, but not the United States)
AccountActivitiesOutsideUSGrp.SpecificServicesProvidedTxt: Grants are provided to member schools within Canada.

GrantsToOrgOutsideUSGrp.RegionTxt: North America (including Canada and Mexico, but not the United States)
GrantsToOrgOutsideUSGrp.PurposeOfGrantTxt: Grants provided to member schools to support organizational planning in support of their mission. Grants given to 16 Canadian schools ranging from $18200-$25000.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Grants are provided to member schools of the Association. Periodic financial and programmatic reports are required to describe activities and how they meet the stated objectives of the grant.
Grants are provided to member schools. Periodic financial and programmatic reports are required to ensure that the activities of the grants are meeting the stated objectives.

RltdOrgOfficerTrstKeyEmplGrp.TitleTxt: Senior Director of Design & Organizational Learning

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, Line 6
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Association is a nonprofit membership organization. Membership in the Association is open to schools located in Canada and the United States that offer graduate professional theological education. As described in the Association's bylaws, the members have the power to (1) adopt the dues structure for members, (2) elect the officers and directors of the Association, and (3) approve amendments to the bylaws.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, Line 7a
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Association is a nonprofit membership organization. Membership in the Association is open to schools located in Canada and the United States that offer graduate professional theological education. As described in the Association's bylaws, the members have the power to (1) adopt the dues structure for members, (2) elect the officers and directors of the Association, and (3) approve amendments to the bylaws.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, Line 7b
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Association is a nonprofit membership organization. Membership in the Association is open to schools located in Canada and the United States that offer graduate professional theological education. As described in the Association's bylaws, the members have the power to (1) adopt the dues structure for members, (2) elect the officers and directors of the Association, and (3) approve amendments to the bylaws.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 11b
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The form 990 is made available to the entire Board of Directors prior to filing.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 12c
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Association has a conflict of interest policy that is signed by key employees and Board members. The Association's COO monitors compliance.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Association has a formal process of determining salary ranges for all employees and for setting compensation for its officers and key employees. This process is carried out by independent Board members on the Coordinating Committee and includes benchmark salary data from various sources.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, Line 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Association make its governing documents, conflict of interest policy, and financial statements available upon request. These requests can be sent to Mr. Chris A Meinzer, Assistant Treasurer, 10 Summit Park Drive, Pittsburgh, PA 15275.

DisregardedEntityName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: Commission on Accrediting of the Association of Theological Schools

OtherOrganizationName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: Commission on Accrediting of the Association of Theological Schools

TransactionsRelatedOrgGrp.MethodOfAmountDeterminationTxt: The Association of Theological Schools (ATS) is related to the Commission on Accrediting (COA) through overlapping membership. In order to seek accreditation through COA, an institution must first become a member of ATS. Through a support services agreement between ATS and COA, ATS provides personnel, operational, and facility services to COA. ATS charges COA for the direct cost of personnel provided for COA work and for indirect support services. The total charged from ATS to COA was $1,174,934 for fiscal 2023.
